title: A sensible script - please help!
content:
Hi there Typophiles.

So, here's the situation: I'm putting together an invitation for a Real estate Company for prospective sellers offering a free market appraisal or house valuation. The company in question is very well established (over 200 years) and a bit posh.

I'm looking for a nice script font which is traditional and a bit posh without being old-fashioned or screaming wedding (Edwardian Script, Balmoral). Legibility is very important and I would prefer if the caps wernt too fancy.

Any suggestions much appreciated
author: geeza49

comments.content:
A little more fashion? [Mommie](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020163803/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/hubertjocham/mommie/)  
A little more casual? [Susa](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020163803/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/hubertjocham/susa/)  
A little more energetic? [Mr. Dafoe](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020163803/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/sudtipos/mr-dafoe/)

Any of these headed in the right direction?

I'm thinking of  
 [Good Vibrations](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020163803/http:/new.myfonts.com/search/good+vibrations/fonts/) by TypeSetit  
 [Caratterer](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020163803/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/typesetit/carattere/) by TypeSetit  
and  
 [Dream Lover](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020163803/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/typeart/dream-lover/)

I find these elegant, but unpretentious and legible.
Thanks both for your suggestions; I'm feeling Caratterer may work. cheers
